timeline.bodyText: not clear to me what are we guarding. in addition, do we only provide thread-safety for positioned reads not normal reads?
timeline.author: apc999
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -216,12 +249,14 @@ private FileInStream getExternalFileInStream(long pos) throws IOException {
    * Reads a page from external storage which contains the position specified. Note that this makes
    * a copy of the page.
    *
+   * This method is synchronized to ensure thread safety for positioned reads.

replies.bodyText: Yeah, only for positioned reads (PositionedReadable). The read API (InputStream) is not thread safe.
replies.author: calvinjia

replies.bodyText: I explained a bit more in the comment.
replies.author: calvinjia
